reused_details.reused: Luis Enrique was sacked as Spain coach on Thursday after the team's elimination in the last-16 at the World Cup with the country's under-21 manager Luis de la Fuente named as his replacement by the Spanish football federation (RFEF).
reused_by_aic: Luis Enrique is to leave his post as Spain manager and be replaced by Under-21s boss Luis De La Fuente, the country's football federation has announced.

reused_details.reused: Spain were beaten on penalties by Morocco after a goalless draw on Tuesday in an upset result after failing to turn their dominance into a victory.
reused_by_aic: Spain suffered a disappointing last-16 exit at the World Cup after losing to Morocco on penalties on Tuesday.

reused_details.reused: "The RFEF has chosen Luis de la Fuente as the new (Spain) coach," RFEF said in a statement.
reused_by_aic: In confirming his successor shortly afterwards, a second statement added: "The RFEF has chosen Luis De La Fuente as the new national coach."

reused_details.reused: "The ... RFEF has delivered to the president a report in which it determined that a new project should start for the Spain national team, with the aim of continuing the growth achieved in recent years thanks to the work carried out by Luis Enrique (and the staff).
reused_by_aic: The first statement read: "The sporting management of the RFEF has handed to the president a report in which it is determined a new project should start for the Spain national team, with the aim of continuing with the growth achieved in recent years thanks to the work of Luis Enrique and his coaches.

reused_details.reused: "Both the RFEF president Luis Rubiales and sports director, Jose Francisco Molina have informed Luis Enrique of the decision.
reused_by_aic: "Both the president, Luis Rubiales, and the sports director, Jose Francisco Molina, have transmitted the decision to the coach."

reused_details.reused: The RFEF would like to thank Luis Enrique and his entire coaching staff for the work done in the last few years."
reused_by_aic: The RFEF went on to pay tribute to the good work done by Enrique during his tenure.
It concluded: "The RFEF energetically wishes Luis Enrique and his team the best of luck in their future professional projects."

reused_details.reused: Luis Enrique, who was first appointed Spain coach in 2018, had a contract until the end of the year.
reused_by_aic: Enrique, who guided Barcelona to Champions League glory in 2015, took charge of his country in 2018, shortly after Spain's exit from that year's World Cup.

reused_details.reused: De la Fuente, 61, joined the RFEF in 2013 as the under-15 manager having worked with players like Marco Asensio, goalkeeper Unai Simon, Eric Garcia, Pau Torres, Pedri, Carlos Soler and Dani Olmo when they were youngsters.
reused_by_aic: In confirming his successor shortly afterwards, a second statement added: "The RFEF has chosen Luis De La Fuente as the new national coach."
